name: John Boyd Thatcher State Park - North
description: Thacher State Park is situated along the Helderberg Escarpment, one of the richest fossil-bearing formations in the world.

name: John Boyd Thatcher State Park - South
description: Thacher State Park is situated along the Helderberg Escarpment, one of the richest fossil-bearing formations in the world.

name: Lisha Kill Natural Area
description: A visit to Lisha Kill offers a rare example of an old growth forest in a developed area. Some of the trees, namely the Eastern white pine and Eastern hemlock, are estimated to be well over 200 years old. There are flowing streams at this site, which have deep ravines through the underlying bedrock.

name: Plotter Kill Preserve
description: Nature preserve located out of Schenectady known for its waterfalls and overlooks.

name: Saratoga National Park
description: Here, in 1777, during the American War for Independence, American troops battled and beat a British invasion force, marking the first time in world history that a British Army ever surrendered.

name: Acadia National Park
description: Acadia National Park protects the natural beauty of the highest rocky headlands along the Atlantic coastline of the United States, an abundance of habitats with high biodiversity, clean air and water, and a rich cultural heritage.

name: Peebles Island State Park
description: Peebles Island State Park is at the confluence of the Hudson and Mohawk Rivers.

name: Bear Mountain State Park
description: Bear Mountain State Park is situated in rugged mountains rising from the west bank of the Hudson River.

name: Fox Preserve
description: The Fox Preserve is 70 acres of protected land in Colonie.
